intro: Pyrethrum mikeschinii, commonly known as the Mikeschina pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant produces a fine, powdery substance in its flower heads, which contains natural pyrethrins—compounds used in organic pest control. Pyrethrum mikeschinii thrives in cool, temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it both an ornamental plant and a valuable source of natural insecticides.
